Based on the preference cues provided, I recommend "A Tale of Two Cities" (1859) by Charles Dickens.

The story follows alcoholic lawyer Sydney Carton who travels to Paris during the Reign of Terror to rescue French aristocrat Charles Darnay, husband of the woman he loves.

Despite Carton's efforts, Darnay and his wife are ultimately killed.

In the end, Carton finds himself in a similar situation as the Darnays were facing at the beginning of the story.

Ultimately, Carton sacrifices himself to save Darnay from being executed along with Darnay's wife.

As a result of Carton's sacrifice, Darnay and his wife are able to live happily ever after.

I would highly recommend "The Equalizer" (2014) and "Cinder" (2012). "The Equalizer" is a thrilling action-packed movie directed by Ron Shelton, featuring a cast of talented actors such as James Wilcox, Denzel Washington, Chloë Grace Moretz. The story revolves around a cocky, chauvinistic advertising executive magically acquires the ability to hear what women are thinking. He uses this newfound talent to his advantage in order to solve various crimes that he encounters along the way.
On the other hand, "Cinder" is also an excellent movie to watch. It is an exciting science fiction action-adventure movie directed by James Cameron, featuring a cast of talented actors such as Saffron Burrows, Naomie Harris, Chiwetel Onwuamaka, Sigourney Weaver.
The story revolves around the young Cinder, who lives in a dark post-modern underworld of deceit greed, yet still somehow finds love. After she runs away, her modern "prince" has to think outside of the box to find her.
Overall, both "The Equalizer" (2014) and "Cinder" (2012) are excellent movies that I would highly recommend to watch.
